Detailed Description

Class for a FILE block. Used mainly in agent files, a FILE block can contain any type of data These blocks are primarily used for sprite, body data and genetics files. You can only tell which type of file it is by looking at the file's name

Definition at line 9 of file FILEBlock.php.

Member Function Documentation

FILEBlock::CompileBlockData (  )  [protected]

Compiles the block's data This function is for compatibility with PrayBlock's abstract class and allows FILEBlocks to be "compiled" and "decompiled"

Definition at line 23 of file FILEBlock.php.

FILEBlock::DecompileBlockData (  )  [protected]

Decompiles the block's data In other blocks, this function would convert the binary data from the block into useful data. In FILEBlocks, this is impractical because the binary data could be in any c2e file format.

Definition at line 31 of file FILEBlock.php.

FILEBlock::FILEBlock ( $  prayfile,
$  name,
$  content,
$  flags 
)

Creates a new FILEBlock

Parameters:
$prayfile The PRAYFile this FILEBlock belongs to. Can be null.
$name The name of this file block (also the file's name)
$content The binary data of this file block.
$flags The block's flags. See PrayBlock.
